content: The Act may be cited as the "Ships to be Recycled in the States Act" or the "STORIS Act". Annual report required on disposition of vessels not worth preserving. Section 57102 of title 46, United States Code, is amended to require an annual report on the vessel disposal program for obsolete government-owned vessels. The report will be submitted to specific Senate and House committees. Each annual report required by section 57102 of title 46, United States Code, must include the total amount of appropriated funds expended for the vessel disposal program and sales accrued and disbursed for such program and disposal. SEC. 3. AUDIT OF VESSEL DISPOSAL PROGRAM. The Comptroller General of the United States is required to conduct a full audit of excess Federal Government vessel sales contracts by the Maritime Administration from January 1, 1994, to the present, including receivables, expenditures, and internal safeguards against waste, fraud, and abuse. The Comptroller General of the United States is mandated to audit excess Federal Government vessel sales contracts by the Maritime Administration, focusing on internal safeguards, agency management, contracts awarded to non-highest bidders, and agreements with other agencies. The Comptroller General audits excess Federal Government vessel sales contracts by the Maritime Administration, in coordination with various Government agencies to dispose of vessels in compliance with relevant laws. SEC. 4. OBSOLETE VESSELS. Prohibition on transfers to noncitizens and selection of scrapping facilities are amended. Availability of funds from sale and scrapping of obsolete vessels is also modified. The Secretary can use the remainder of funds for the Program. Best value criteria for selecting ship recycling companies is amended. SEC. 5. DISMANTLEMENT OF VESSELS. Section 6(e) of the Toxic Substances Control Act is amended to allow dismantling of vessels or marine structures for recycling materials recovered, with requirements for handling polychlorinated biphenyls if found during dismantling. SEC. 6. REEFS FOR MARINE LIFE CONSERVATION PROGRAM. Prohibition on Transfer of Obsolete Vessels to Foreign Countries amended. Conforming Amendment made. SEC. 7. PUBLICATION OF MARITIME ADMINISTRATION AGREEMENTS.
